shows.title: Remembered
shows.desc:
Yvonne Battle-Felton reads from her debut novel Remembered, which the Guardian called “a searing history of slavery combined with an interrogation of motherhood”, and talks about her path to publishing and writing happily ever afters – or not. Followed by Q&A.

Yvonne Battle-Felton is a writer of fiction and creative non-fiction. She is an associate lecturer at Lancaster University.
